class ObexServerPort

Detailed Description

Internal abstraction of an OBEX server at transport level.

Warning;
This is an internal interface and must not be used outside APOXI OBEX at all.

Its purpose is to provide an abstraction of the underlying transport connections and notify OBEX protocol events to the application layer without further evaluation. This activity is left to derived classes.

An ObexServerDispatcher may comprise multiple ObexServerPort instances listening for incoming transport connections, but only one port can be active at a time. While one port is active, incoming connection requests from all other ports are rejected.

ObexServerPort instances are bound dynamically when a transport media is enabled and released when it is disabled. These events are notified by calls to OnBind() / OnRelease().

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef ObexEventHandler ObexServerDispatcher::Base
 

Reimplemented in ObexServer.

typedef NiSharedPtr<ObexServerPort> ObexServerDispatcher::ServerPortPtr [protected]
 

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum ObexServerDispatcher::OpenFlags
 

The following flags are used to customize server behaviour. They can be combined using the '|' operator. When adding new flags, please be aware that each flag should have its own bit, so all values must be powers of 2.

See also:
Open()
Enumerator:
SdbAutoRegister  Attempt to automatically create a Service Discovery Database entry.
PrivateTransport  Reserve a transport channel for this server.

Member Function Documentation

ObexResult ObexServerDispatcher::Close (   )  [virtual]
 

Deactivates the server and releases its bindings.

After the Close() operation has been completed, the server will no longer accept incoming requests.

Initializes a default-constructed object.

Parameters:
ctx_ptr Execution context to be used by the dispatcher. You may pass '0' as actual parameter to specify the current execution context. In the latter case, the context must be valid when Init() is called.

BOOLEAN ObexServerDispatcher::IsValidContext (   )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Tells whether the current context is valid for message processing.

When an OBEX event handler is shared among multiple execution contexts (this means multiple ObexDispatcher instances are associated with one ObexEventHandler instance), this method should be implemented to return 'TRUE' in the context where processing and notification of OBEX events is appropriate, 'FALSE' otherwise.

In the simple case where the event handler is receiving messages from only one execution context, the method may be implemented to always return 'TRUE'.

Implements ObexEventHandler.

Reimplemented in ObexServerOppImpl.

ObexResult  result
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Indicates binding of a transport channel to the server.

Parameters:
addr_ptr Smartpointer to OBEX address that was attempted to bind.
result Either tells that the bind operation was successful or provides error information.

void ObexServerDispatcher::OnRelease (  const ObexAddrPtr &  addr_ptr,
ObexResult  result
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Indicates loss of a transport channel binding.

Parameters:
addr_ptr Smartpointer to OBEX address whose binding was released.
result If the result indicates success, the binding was removed due to a call to Close(), otherwise it happened due to a spontanous event further described by the error code.

ObexResult ObexServerDispatcher::Open (  const String &  obex_addr_url,
UINT8  open_flags = 0,
const ObexTransportSet &  excl_xport_set = ObexTransportSet()
)  [virtual]
 

Activates the server and binds its address to one or more transport channels.

Open() must be called on the server in order to resolve the specified address in URL format and bind it to one or more transport channels. For each transport channel bound OnBind() is called once.

Parameters:
obex_addr_url OBEX address in URL format incl. Target. Please see OBEX URL's for more information.
open_flags Flags used to customize server behaviour.
excl_xport_set Set of transports not to be bound by the server
See also:
OpenFlags
